content.question: Which of the following claims does the author make in Source 2?

choices.label: The empire of Songhai was the last and largest of the Sudanic West African states that patronized learning centers like Sankoré.
The creation of learning centers like Sankoré attracted trans-Saharan commerce including merchants and traders from across North Africa.
Timbuktu was a crucial center of education and religion, and supported the spread of Islam in the region.
Mali and Songhai were Sudanic states that grew wealthy from gold mines and trade routes facilitating the creation of mosques in Timbuktu.

content.answer: Timbuktu was a crucial center of education and religion, and supported the spread of Islam in the region.
